name: Artichoke Spinach Cauliflower Bean Burgers. Grill-able Vegan Veggie Burger Recipe.
description: These Grill-able Aritchoke Spinach burgers are easy and great for summer. Use any favorite dressings or toppings.
recipeIngredient: 15 oz great northern beans like Eden Organic (or other white beans, or 1.5 cups cooked)
1/3 cup chopped white or red onion
2 Tbsp flax seed meal or Chia Seeds (I used 1 Tbsp flax and 1 Tbsp chia)
1/4 cup cashews or use seeds to make nut-free
1/4 cup breadcrumbs  (or oat flour or chickpea flour)

recipeInstructions.text: In a food processor, process all the ingredients from beans till cumin powder until most of the beans are mashed. Move to a bowl. Add mustard, olive oil, lemon juice and nutritional yeast and mix.
recipeInstructions.name: In a food processor, process all the ingredients from beans till cumin powder until most of the beans are mashed. Move to a bowl. Add mustard, olive oil, lemon juice and nutritional yeast and mix.

recipeInstructions.text: In the processor, process cauliflower, carrots and cashews until crumbs. Add to the bowl and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In the processor, process cauliflower, carrots and cashews until crumbs. Add to the bowl and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add breadcrumbs and mix. Use less or more crumbs/flour to get a soft and not too wet, but also not crumbly mixture. Shape into patties by packing into a 3.5 inch cookie cutter. Place on parchment lined sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Add breadcrumbs and mix. Use less or more crumbs/flour to get a soft and not too wet, but also not crumbly mixture. Shape into patties by packing into a 3.5 inch cookie cutter. Place on parchment lined sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: freeze and grill. Freeze patties for 15 minutes. Spray oil on the patties. The patties get well set when chilled. Grill frozen patties for 3 to 4 minutes each side.
recipeInstructions.name: freeze and grill. Freeze patties for 15 minutes. Spray oil on the patties. The patties get well set when chilled. Grill frozen patties for 3 to 4 minutes each side.

recipeInstructions.text: Par-bake and grill. Bake the patties for 20 minutes at pre-heated 400 degree F / 200ºc. Grill the par-baked patties also for 3 to 4 minutes each side. Refrigerate until ready to grill, if grilling later.
recipeInstructions.name: Par-bake and grill. Bake the patties for 20 minutes at pre-heated 400 degree F / 200ºc. Grill the par-baked patties also for 3 to 4 minutes each side. Refrigerate until ready to grill, if grilling later.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the patties: Bake at pre-heated 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 20 minutes, then flip the patties and bake for 10-15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the patties: Bake at pre-heated 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 20 minutes, then flip the patties and bake for 10-15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: I served these with Tahini sauce, cucumbers, sriracha and tomato. Some caramelized onions, spicy chipotle ranch/mayo sauce, vegan cheese slices, pickles, ketchup, mustard etc would work beautifully as well. For Chipotle Ranch, add chipotle pepper powder to taste to this ranch sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: I served these with Tahini sauce, cucumbers, sriracha and tomato. Some caramelized onions, spicy chipotle ranch/mayo sauce, vegan cheese slices, pickles, ketchup, mustard etc would work beautifully as well. For Chipotle Ranch, add chipotle pepper powder to taste to this ranch sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: For Variations: Use other beans, add vegan cheese shreds to the patties, add a chipotle pepper and adobo sauce in the first step.
recipeInstructions.name: For Variations: Use other beans, add vegan cheese shreds to the patties, add a chipotle pepper and adobo sauce in the first step.
